result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Makel Lonell Joiner

records.addlTxt: All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Makel Lonell Joiner in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appears as a friend of the court for Makel Lonell Joiner.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant. Defendant did not appear for his court appearance on November 1, 2022 due to having the wrong court information. Due to defendant appearing in court, Court canceled bench warrant and reinstated bail. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. Indigency hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Makel Lonell Joiner not in court.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court further orders that bail is forfeited. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Makel Lonell Joiner appeared by video.  Attorney Margo Elise Clark appeared by video for Makel Lonell Joiner. Attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Makel Lonell Joiner not in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/29/22 @ 1p
